alert.note: Alert for Marion; Sequatchie (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 03 at 1:14PM CST until March 03 at 1:45PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EST/145 PM CST/ FOR SOUTHEASTERN SEQUATCHIE...SOUTH CENTRAL BLEDSOE...SOUTHEASTERN MARION AND CENTRAL HAMILTON COUNTIES... At 214 PM EST/114 PM CST/, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles northeast of Decatur, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Chattanooga, Pikeville, Soddy-Daisy, Signal Mountain, Walden, Lakesite, Ridgeside, Fairmount, Harrison and Red Bank. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EST/400 PM CST/ for east Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
